alert.note: Alert for Mayes; Rogers; Tulsa; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued October 04 at 7:09PM CDT until October 04 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Rogers County in northeastern Oklahoma... Southwestern Mayes County in northeastern Oklahoma... Wagoner County in northeastern Oklahoma... Southeastern Tulsa County in northeastern Oklahoma... * Until 800 PM CDT. * At 709 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 2 miles north of Tulsa International Airport to 4 miles southwest of Catoosa to 7 miles south of Bixby, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Wagoner... Bixby... Jenks... Coweta... Catoosa... Verdigris... Inola... Tulsa International Airport... Stonebluff... Oneta... Turley... Redbird... Mazie... Leonard... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 223 and 243. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
